datos.pregunta: 1. What is the supreme law of the land?
2. What does the Constitution do?
datos.respuesta: Sets up the government. Defines the government. Protects basic rights of Americans
datos.propuesta: Budget the government.Protects basic rights of Americans

datos.pregunta: 3. The idea of self-government is in the first three words of the Constitution.. What are these words?
4. What is an amendment?
datos.respuesta: A change (to the Constitution). An addition (to the Constitution)
datos.propuesta: A fix in the Goverment.A change to the Constitution.A mistake in the Constitution

datos.pregunta: 5. What do we call the first ten amendments to the Constitution?
datos.propuesta: The Rights of the People.The Right things.The Bill of Rights

datos.pregunta: 6. What is one right or freedom from the First Amendment?
7. How many amendments does the Constitution have?
8. What did the Declaration of Independence do?
datos.respuesta: Announced our independence (from Great Britain).Declared our independence(from Great Britain).Said that the United States is free(from Great Britain)
datos.propuesta: Got our peolpe free.Announced our independence (from Great Britain).Played ball

datos.pregunta: 9. What are two rights in the Declaration of Independence?
10. What is freedom of religion?
datos.respuesta: You can practice any religion, or not practice a religion
datos.propuesta: You become a pastor.You can practice any religion, or not practice a religion
datos.correcta: You can practice any religion, or not practice a religion

datos.pregunta: 11. What is the economic system in the United States?
12. What is the “rule of law”?
datos.respuesta: Everyone must follow the law.Leaders must obey the law.Government must obey the law.No one is above the law
datos.propuesta: The President does not have to follow the law.Everyone must follow the law.

datos.pregunta: 13. Name one branch or part of the government.
datos.respuesta: - Congress  - Legislative  - President  - Executive  - The Courts  - Judicial

datos.pregunta: 14. What stops one branch of government from becoming too powerful ?
15. Who is in charge of the executive branch ?
16. Who makes federal laws?
datos.respuesta: Congress.Senate and House (of Representatives).(U.S. or national) Legislature
datos.correcta: Congress, the Senate and House (of Representatives) and the (U.S. or national) Legislature

datos.pregunta: 17. What are the two parts of the U.S. Congress?
18. How many U.S. Senators are there?
19. We elect a U.S. Senator for how many years?
20. Who is one of your state’s U.S. Senators now?
21. The House of Representatives has how many voting members?
22. We elect a U.S. Representative for how many years?
23. Name your U.S. Representative.
24. Who does a U.S. Senator represent?
25. Why do some states have more Representatives than other states?
datos.respuesta: - (Because of) the state’s population  - (Because) they have more people  - (Because) some states have more people

datos.pregunta: 26. We elect a President for how many years?
27. In what month do we vote for President?
28. What is the name of the President of the United States now? Visit for information!
29. What is the name of the Vice President of the United States now? Visit for information!
30. If the President can no longer serve, who becomes President?
31. If both the President and the Vice President can no longer serve, who becomes President?
32. Who is the Commander in Chief of the military?
33. Who signs bills to become laws?
34. Who vetoes bills?
35. What does the President’s Cabinet do?
36. What are two Cabinet-level positions?
datos.respuesta: - Secretary of Agriculture- Secretary of Commerce- Secretary of Defense- Secretary of Education- Secretary of Energy- Secretary of Health and Human Services- Secretary of Homeland Security- Secretary of Housing and Urban Development- Secretary of the Interior- Secretary of Labor- Secretary of State- Secretary of Transportation- Secretary of the Treasury- Secretary of Veterans Affairs- Attorney General- Vice President

datos.pregunta: 37. What does the judicial branch do?
datos.respuesta: Reviews laws  - Explains laws  - Resolves disputes (disagreements)  - Decides if a law goes against the Constitution

datos.pregunta: 38. What is the highest court in the United States?
39. How many justices are on the Supreme Court? Visit for information!
40. Who is the Chief Justice of the United States now? Visit for information!
41. Under our Constitution, some powers belong to the federal government.  What is one power of the federal government?
datos.respuesta: - To print money  - To declare war  - To create an army  - To make treaties

datos.pregunta: 42. Under our Constitution, some powers belong to the states.  What is one power of the states?
datos.respuesta: - Provide schooling and education  - Provide protection(police)  - Provide safety(fire departments)  - Give a driver’s license  - Approve zoning and land use

datos.pregunta: 43. Who is the Governor of your state now?
44. What is the capital of your state?
45. What are the two major political parties in the United States?
46. What is the political party of the President now? Visit for information!
47. What is the name of the Speaker of the House of Representatives now? Visit for information!
48. There are four amendments to the Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them.
datos.respuesta: - Citizens eighteen (18) and older (can vote).- You don’t have to pay (a poll tax) to vote.- Any citizen can vote. (Women and men can vote.)- A male citizen of any race (can vote).

datos.pregunta: 49. What is one responsibility that is only for United States citizens?
datos.respuesta: - serve on a jury- vote in a federal election

datos.pregunta: 50. Name one right only for United States citizens.
datos.respuesta: - vote in a federal election- run for federal office

datos.pregunta: 51. What are two rights of everyone living in the United States?
datos.respuesta: - freedom of expression- freedom of speech- freedom of assembly- freedom to petition the government- freedom of religion- the right to bear arms

datos.pregunta: 52. What do we show loyalty to when we say the Pledge of Allegiance?
53. What is one promise you make when you become a United States citizen?
datos.respuesta: - give up loyalty to other countries.- defend the Constitution and laws of the United States- obey the laws of the United States.- serve in the U.S. military (if needed).- serve (do important work for) the nation (if needed).- be loyal to the United States.

datos.pregunta: 54. How old do citizens have to be to vote for President?
55. What are two ways that Americans can participate in their democracy?
datos.respuesta: - vote.- join a political party.- help with a campaign.- join a civic group.- join a community group.- give an elected official your opinion on an issue.- call Senators and Representatives.- publicly support or oppose an issue or policy.- run for office.- write to a newspaper.

datos.pregunta: 56. When is the last day you can send in federal income tax forms?
57. When must all men register for the Selective Service?
datos.respuesta: - at age eighteen (18).- between eighteen (18) and twenty-six (26).

datos.pregunta: 58. What is one reason colonists came to America?
datos.respuesta: - freedom.- political liberty.- religious freedom.- economic opportunity.- practice their religion.- escape persecution.

datos.pregunta: 59. Who lived in America before the Europeans arrived?
60. What group of people was taken to America and sold as slaves?
61.Why did the colonists fight the British?
datos.respuesta: - because of high taxes (taxation without representation).- because the British army stayed in their houses (boarding, quartering).- because they didn’t have self-government.
